channel.title: PHP removing last comma using rtrim [solved]
channel.description:
[b]solved. Edit: Turned out it was an error with the logic, I was never storing the trimmed version of the variable back inside so the output never changed. [/b] I'm trying to remove the last comma but it seems to not be working, can anyone spot the mistake or tell me how to get this to work please? p.s I do not like the substr method.
string(42) "`id`='0', `fname`='bob', `lname`='fakey', " `id`='0', `fname`='bob', `lname`='fakey', <-- want to get rid of the last comma there
rtrim($variable, ", "); // does not work (at least not during the tests) rtrim($variable, ', '); // does not work (at least not during the tests)

item.title: PHP removing last comma using rtrim [solved]
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

[quote=“mutex_, post:2, topic:400754”]You’re trying to rtrim a comma followed by a space. Try doing this instead:

rtrim($variable,",");[/quote]
He said it was fixed. For those who don’t understand his solution, I believe it’s because the rtrim() function has a return value rather than passing the variable by reference. Therefore you need to use:
$var = rtrim($var, ', ')
